blocks.text: The TR-35 is a 4-band (40m, 30m, 20m, 17m) 5-watt CW transceiver with selectable receiver modes for narrow band CW, wideband CW, and SSB reception. Features OLED display, keyer memory, and dial lock.
Front panel controls: Keyer Speed (5-45 WPM), TX Power (0-5W), RF Gain, and Volume. Power switch at upper left, Receiver Mode/AUX switch in middle, Band/RIT switch at right.
Tuning encoder tunes at 10 Hz, 100 Hz, or 1 kHz steps (40, 400, or 4000 Hz per revolution). Short press toggles 10/100 Hz, long press enables 1 kHz. An underline shows selected digit.
The transmitter will not operate out-of-band and displays OOB warning if attempted. Generous tuning range above and below each band is provided for SWL.

blocks.name: Band Switch (quick up)
blocks.description: Change bands consecutively: 40m, 30m, 20m, 17m, then back to 40m.

blocks.name: Band Switch (hold up)
blocks.description: Store current frequency and mode in semi-permanent memory. Display momentarily reverses to confirm. Separate memory for each band.

blocks.name: Band Switch (2 quick ups)
blocks.description: Recall stored memory for current band.

blocks.name: RIT Switch (quick down)
blocks.description: Toggle RIT on/off. Orange LED illuminates when active. Display shows offset with 10 Hz resolution.

blocks.name: RIT Switch (hold down ~1.5 sec)
blocks.description: Toggle Dial Lock to prevent tuning and band changes. Another long hold to exit.

blocks.name: Mode Switch (quick up)
blocks.description: Toggle between Narrow Band CW and Wide Band CW. Display frequency maintains calibration.

blocks.name: Mode Switch (hold up)
blocks.description: Enable SSB receive mode with appropriate IF bandwidth and frequency calibration.

blocks.text: Built-in keyer with speed adjustable 5-45 WPM. Both straight key and paddle jacks provided - connect both and use either without rebooting. Always ready for SKCC contacts with straight key.
Two message memories, each storing 25 words (PARIS standard) or 125 characters. Record: hold AUX, select M1 (dit) or M2 (dah), key message, stop sending to auto-save after 3 seconds.
Playback: quick AUX, select M1 (dit) or M2 (dah). Stop with either paddle or AUX switch. Transmitter is active during playback - turn down power when testing.
The sidetone is the actual transmitted signal heard by the receiver. Match received signal tone to sidetone for guaranteed zero-beat.
Selectable receiver modes: Narrow Band CW, Wide Band CW, and SSB. The IF bandwidth changes automatically for each mode.
Audio bandpass filter frequency adjustable via internal trimmer (front of lower board). Adjust for maximum sidetone volume in narrow CW mode - typically near center of rotation.
Supply voltage 9.5-14V via 5.5mm/2.1mm jack (center positive). At 12V, output is approximately 5W into 50 ohms.
Blue LED indicates signal strength. Red LED blinks when battery drops below preset level (adjustable 9-11.5V internally, factory set ~9.5V).

The TR-35 is designed for CW duty cycle only. Extended key-down at maximum power activates polyfuse protection, reducing output. The polyfuse is self-resetting after cooling. Turn down power for antenna adjustments.
The TR-35 does not include an internal antenna tuner. Use an external tuner for non-resonant antennas.

rows.name: Key Jack
rows.value: 3.5mm, tip and ground (mono or stereo plug)

blocks.name: Power output drops during extended TX
blocks.description: Polyfuse protection activated due to excessive key-down time. Let radio cool for several minutes. Turn down power for antenna adjustments and testing.

blocks.name: Only one headphone earpiece plays
blocks.description: Phones jack wired for mono. Use 3.5mm mono-to-stereo adapter, or add internal jumper (Rev B boards only, see manual for details).

blocks.name: Red LED blinking
blocks.description: Low battery warning. Voltage below preset threshold (factory ~9.5V). Recharge or replace battery.

blocks.name: Recording sidetone sounds clicky
blocks.description: Turn down RF gain control during recording to reduce interference.
